text: Machine learning (ML) emerges as a form of artificial intelligence poised to revolutionize the twenty-first century. Recent, rapid advancements in its underlying architecture and algorithms, coupled with the expansion of dataset sizes, have propelled computer capabilities across various domains. These encompass tasks such as driving vehicles, language translation, chatbots, and surpassing human proficiency in complex board games like Go. This review delves into the foundational aspects and algorithms underpinning machine learning, shedding light on specific learning and optimization methodologies. Furthermore, it provides an overview of ML applications in the field of medicine. Notably, recent diagnostic achievements and considerations in areas such as dermatology, radiology, pathology, and general microscopy are outlined.
name: fid-104
